text: So, I just started getting blasted with hundreds of notification emails
From HubSpot
"New unassigned email conversation"
I think they're triggering themselves?
Like each notification is triggering the next one
I don't really use this part of HubSpot a lot, but these notifications should maybe just ignore <mailto:noreply@HubSpot.com|noreply@HubSpot.com> and <mailto:success@HubSpot.com|success@HubSpot.com>
I disabled the notifications, but boy was that alarming to wake up to
Iâ€™m still getting them actually, but hopefully the server is just lagging on that setting
It looks like maybe it's stopped
Hey Ian, This happened today for me with a client that added their own email address to HubSpot conversations - I submitted it as an issue to the HubSpot team
Yeah we've got the offending email address removed from the portal
Can you not use smart content in a rich text area thats inside of a flexible column?
wait nevermind, i should of investigated, person wasnt aware what they were seeing :man-facepalming:
Wait, i lied, it looks like only the first rich text allows it, but if you add another rich text via the "Add Moudles" they are not able to be made smart
any ideas why?

Is there a way to add a class to the wrapping `<td>` element in the email when using the drag and drop? For example, in the below image, you can add a class to the image element, but it only gets added to the table wrapping the image, not the `<td>` element in which the image sits
my goal is to make it so when viewing the email on desktop, you will see the image on the right but when on mobile, this image will sit above the text.
I can I can always double up the lines and then hide via a media query if needed but simply floating the items in css would be easier.
looks like wrapping then im a module group similar to the how the left side is done does the trick.
I can tell you from way too much time spent doing html emails. Do it the hide method. floating might make you question your decision to be a web developer

IF you do decide to take the floating path, <http://emailgeeks.slack.com|emailgeeks.slack.com>

This slack has basically all of the top html email devs out there in it. As well as people from Litmus, Email on Acid, Google.

_Warning, if you enter that slack, YOU WILL SEE WIZARDS!_ (seriously these people do crap with tables and CSS that makes you question reality)
lol yea i just saw floats are a no in Outlook 07-16 ugh
hiding it is
<@U7SL518D6> it doesnt look like we can just add ourselves to that slack channel.
Oh hmm
<https://email.geeks.chat>
